hoonigan

Class InitializeProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • hoonigan.InitializeProgram

  • public class InitializeProgram
extends java.lang.Object
    InitializeProgram class This class instantiates a Parser object, which reads a JSON file, Parses the JSON file, and stores the Elements within the JSON file into a HashMap. The class also contains a search method which searches the HashMap for a String ID number, and a method which instantiates a text-based interface.
    Author:
    Hoonigan

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        init() This method initializes the majority of needed resources within the Library program. It reads a JSON file, Parses the JSON file, and stores the elements into a HashMap. Instructor's Note: Input JSON file is hardcoded. To change File Location, change the JSON location found in the 'reader' variable in the init() method below.

      • getlibraryMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,hoonigan.Library_Items> getlibraryMap()
        getlibraryMap Simple getter method.
        Returns:
        libraryMap - A HashMap containing Library_Items

      • search

        public hoonigan.Library_Items search(java.lang.String id)
        search(String id) This method searches the Hash Map data structure with an ID field, and returns one Library_Items if both ID fields match
        Parameters:
        id - - The id of a Library_Items
        Returns:
        found - The Library_Items that was found with a matching id (Returns NULL if no Library_Items was found)

      • getAllLibraryElements

        public java.lang.String getAllLibraryElements()
        getAllLibraryElements() This method returns all elements in the HashMap as a String, using an iterator
        Returns:
        line - a String containing all elements of the HashMap

      • printWelcome

        public java.lang.String printWelcome()
        printWelcome() This method returns a string containing an Introductory Message, as well as every HashMap elements toString() method.
        Returns:
        line - A string that contains an Introductory Software Message, as well as every HashMap elements toString() method

      • userOption

        public int userOption()
        userOption() This method asks the user for an integer input, where 0 = user wants to check-out, and 1 = user wants to check-in
        Returns:
        checkStatus - an integer, that represents whether the user wants to check-out or check-in

      • searchQueryResult

        public hoonigan.Library_Items searchQueryResult(int checkStatus)
        searchQueryResult(int checkStatus) This method asks the user for a String input, which will be used as a key in searching the Library_Items HashMap for a matching element.
        Parameters:
        checkStatus - - an integer input; Where 0 = user wants to check out, and 1 = user wants to check-in
        Returns:
        found - a Library_Items object within the HashMap (returns NULL if no object was found)

      • doLibraryOperations

        public void doLibraryOperations(int checkStatus,
                                hoonigan.Library_Items found)
        doLibraryOperations(int checkStatus, Library_Items found) This method performs either a CheckOut or CheckIn of a Library Item. What Item is used, and what method is called upon it depends on the parameters that were passed in.
        Parameters:
        checkStatus - - an integer input; Where 0 = user wants to check out, and 1 = user wants to check-in.
        found - - a Library_Items object that was found by searchQueryResult(int checkStatus)

      • askUserToContinue

        public int askUserToContinue()
        askUserToContinue() This method asks the user if they would like to run the program again.
        Returns:
        runProgram - an integer, where a value of 1 represents that the user would like to run the program again.

      • runProgram

        public void runProgram()
        runProgram() This method calls the init() method, which initializes the entire program. It then runs a loop which calls various other methods which do the following: (1) Greets the user (2) Asks if they would like to Check-In or Check-Out (3) Queries the HashMap data structure of Libraries (4) Performs the Check-In and Checkout methods accordingly (5) Asks the user if they would like to run the loop again
